author: Slidebean
description:
Why Apple is investing in manufacturing knowledge, not factories.

Apple’s new manufacturing academy sends its own engineers into U.S. factories to identify operational bottlenecks and redesign workflows.
Rather than funding equipment upgrades, the focus is on transferring process discipline and production expertise.

The early results suggest a powerful insight:
resilient supply chains depend less on capital and more on institutional knowledge.
Apple isn’t reshoring manufacturing, it’s reshoring how to manufacture.

👉 Visit our YouTube channel for more content.
title: Apple engineers are quietly fixing American factories, one bottleneck at a time
